name: Palma
address: 28 Cornelia St, New York, NY 10014, USA

reviews.text:
It was more than a dinner, it was literally MAGICAL experience (every step, every page of the menu, every piece of tableware, every gesture of the staff who took care of us) and my family was nothing but delighted with food, ambience and hospitality!! and the FLOWERS, oh, the flowers!! Absolutely wonderful, absolutely must visit for everyone who wants to try the best (imho) Italian food in nyc and no doubt get the best wine options.
Im so happy we decided to try different meals, and from the very first bite of focaccia we enjoyed everything. Canâ€™t wait to be back and explore more!!
such a cute place! great service and great quality ingredients, would recommend skipping the focaccia, nothing special
Delicious dinner with great service. The sourdough focaccia.. saffron risotto.. chicken Milanese & lobster spaghetti all hit the spot ğŸ‘Œ

Palma is undeniably beautiful, and the staff were friendly. However, the food was one of the most underwhelming Italian meals Iâ€™ve had. I came in with high hopes after hearing great things on social media, but was disappointed by the overall quality. It felt like youâ€™re mostly paying for the ambiance rather than the food itself. That said, the service was efficient and the dishes came out quickly, which I did appreciate. Unfortunately, I donâ€™t think Iâ€™d return.
How can this pasta be gluten free? It is soooo good. Amazing drinks and great service. Nick was the best server! I canâ€™t recommend this place enough.

Palma was by far one the best Italian restaurants I have ever been to. The staff are incredible professional and kind, the place is cozy and beautiful and the food is absolutely delicious. No wonder why you have to book a table weeks or months in advance.

An Absolute West Village Gem!
We just had the most magnificent lunch at Palma and I am still dreaming about it! This restaurant is a true destination.

The design and decor are super charmingâ€”it feels like stepping into a sun-drenched Italian villa. We were lucky enough to dine in their outdoor covered patio space, and I highly recommend it. It was incredibly romantic and intimate, perfect for a special meal with my partner.

We started by sharing the delectable tomato tart along with the radicchio and fig salad. Both were light, fresh, and beautifully executed, proving that even the simplest dishes here are crafted with care.

For our main courses, the kitchen really shined:
* My partnerâ€™s Chicken Milanese was perfectly cookedâ€”crispy on the outside, and wonderfully moist and juicy inside.
* My fresh cod was divine! It was served atop a rich hazelnut cream sauce and complemented by fresh, earthy chanterelle mushrooms.

Every bite, from start to finish, was pure joy. Adding to the wonderful atmosphere was the welcoming and friendly hospitality of the staff, which made us feel completely at home.

We loved our experience so much that we are already planning a return trip before we leave the city! We canâ€™t recommend Palma enough for a delicious and memorable dining experience.

The most unreal Italian food Iâ€™ve ever have. We had the gnocchi (Iâ€™ll be dreaming about it for the rest of my life), the steak and eggplant parmigiana. Everything melts in your mouth and is simply divine. 100/10

From the moment we set foot in Palma to the moment we walked out, we were treated to an absolute world-class experience. The level of service and hospitality was simply unmatched â€” warm, attentive, and genuinely passionate.
Andy and Guillaume took exceptional care of us throughout the evening.

Their professionalism, charm, and deep knowledge of the menu elevated our entire experience. Itâ€™s rare to feel so well looked after, and they truly made us feel like honored guests.

Everything we ordered â€” from the drinks to the appetizers, entrees, and desserts â€” was nothing short of exquisite. Each dish was perfectly balanced, beautifully presented, and bursting with flavor.

And the tiramisuâ€¦ where do I even begin? Hands down the best Iâ€™ve ever had â€” possibly the best on the planet. Creamy, rich, and flawlessly executed â€” it was the perfect finale to an already unforgettable meal.
Really enjoyed the fresh gluten free ravioli and pasta. The garden is beautiful to sit in and the service was great.
Great wine list fresh pasta dishes  interesting menu very very good great service
I had a great experience! Food, service and environment was amazing!

Food is mid and bland for the price ($30+ per dish for small portions) but vibes/atmosphere is good.
Mostly vegan and gluten free dairy free options so if you're into that, not bad for dates and special occasions.

If just looking for quality Italian food, 100+ other options in the city. It is NYC after all.

Wouldn't return again.

This was our second time at Palma and we were pretty disappointed. Our pasta was served room temp at best and my husbandâ€™s cream sauce had a gritty texture. The wine that was picked by the sommelier was â€œthinâ€ and too acidic. Iâ€™ve had much better wine at a much cheaper price point. The restaurant is beautiful and I love the atmosphere. The service was okay.. not stellar, but there are better meals to be had in NYC.
Great neighborhood spot tucked away in the West Village on Cornelia Street. Delicious menu and great service. Fantastic place for a special occasion.

Probably the worst vongole pasta Iâ€™ve ever had. The clams were undercooked and tasted fishy. The portion was already small, but I couldnâ€™t even finish it. On top of that, it felt like my pasta was missing a sauceâ€”I never asked for it to be left out.

When I asked what their signature pasta was, the waiter just said people order something different every timeâ€”which was not exactly reassuring.

As a walk-in guest, I was annoyed right from the entrance when a lady pushed for unnecessary personal details. That level of aggressiveness completely disappeared by the time I leftâ€”no goodbye, nothing.

Overall, the food and service donâ€™t justify the price. Totally overrated. I still left a tip, but honestly, it felt like a waste.
Very nice restaurant, we celebrate our wedding ceremony here!
Amazing food, service, and atmosphere. Best pasta I've ever had. 10/10 no notes.

Palma is a lovely spot in the West Village, though it does run pricey for what you get. Portions are on the smaller side, but the food itself is fresh and well prepared. The skylight patio is especially charmingâ€” intimate and cozy, perfect for a date night or small gathering. The overall experience was enjoyable, just not sure if the value stands out enough to become a regular spot.

Overrated. Overpriced. Garden is cute, but doesnâ€™t outweigh the poor service. Maybe we just got stuck with a bad apple, but very unfriendly and aloof. Food was fine, but was not memorable. Mostly just not worth the price for the portion you receive. Feels like a joint that could be hit or miss, we just unfortunately got the lack luster experience,
Stunning romantic Italian ambiance with delicious food in West Village. Our favorites were the arancini and ravioli!
The desert was amazing
Lovely enclave on a quieter street.  The pasta and appetizers were delicious!!!  Server was very friendly.
Worldâ€™s smallest lamb chops. Forgot to bring our appetizers. Overcharged us on the bill. Will not return

A beautiful place to sit and enjoy a meal. Really nice service and atmosphere but the food was mixed. We had some sensational tortellini but the bolognese was not so good. Tiramisu for dessert was pretty good but not amazing. The courtyard is very pretty as is the entire space.
Perfect for any occasion, lobster spaghetti & bolognese were delicious. Great ambianceğŸ‘ŒğŸ¾

It was a birthday celebration. The food was delicious fresh taste like Italy. The service was amazing and the servers were knowledgeable of the menu and made sure they checked in. The mushroom fettuccine and the lamb chops were delicious entrees. I also loved the appetizers. I would definitely come back. I wish I took more pics of the food but it was a such a good time. I would highly recommend this place if youâ€™re looking to do a birthday dinner, good deal for 9 people. With like 3 rounds of drinks, appetizers, dinner and dessert was around 1600$ including tip and gratuity for 9 people but of course this will vary on how many people you are with and what you order. Thank you all so much.
Terrific Italian restaurant, atmosphere is awesome, staff is great and the food is unbelievable

Not sure why i hadnâ€™t been to or heard much about Palma.  Itâ€™s a true local gem, and one i hope to visit frequently.  The back patio is perfect for a small party or celebration; service is fast and genuinely friendly too.

Been coming here for over a decade and am always impressed with the experience. Absolutely beautiful restaurant, you are surrounded by so many fresh flowers and thoughtful decor. The zuppe de Pesci was so incredible. Itâ€™s one of my favorite dishes to order and the way they make it here is so unique and flavorful. The broth, the fresh fishâ€¦I already want to go back again for it. Highly recommend!
So incredible. Had a variety of dishes including the blooming zucchini, arancini, bolognese, and the pesto gnocchi. Flavors were amazing and the service was good.

The vibes at Palma are unmatched, get ready to get whisked away to a quant little town in Italy! This restaurant came up as having great gluten-free options when I was doing some research for a dinner with some friends. It's rare to find a restaurant that is good at gluten-free pasta but according to my GF friend, the Cacio e Pepe ravioli was amazing.

The quality of the ingredients is so clear as you are eating the food and after. I went with the Paccheri all'Astice: the pasta was perfectly al dente and there was a generous amount of lobster which was also cooked to perfection. The sauce is simple yet flavorful and it's everything you could ever want in a seafood pasta.

Our server Guillaume was so kind and attentive and we were really treated so well throughout the whole evening. I would wholeheartedly recommend this place to all pasta lovers and especially to those with GF diets!
What a delicious and lovely meal. One of the best gluten free pastas I've ever had. Staff was absolutely on point. Espresso martini decaf option to die for. Thank you Palma!

Family of 7 went to celebrate 2 birthdays.  We had a fantastic time.  The food was outstanding.

For fritti: the Arancini and the Flora di Zucca - fabulous!

For primi: Gnocchi Ripieni al Pesto,  Ravioli Cacio de Pepe, Spaghetti alla Nerano and the Pappardelle alla Bolognese - all outstanding!

For secondi: Salmon (special of the day), Tagliata di Manzo and Pollo alla Milanese - Couldn't choose which was the best!

The wine list was amazing with a lot of options.

Highly recommend for a special night out.

Can't wait to travel back to NYC to enjoy!
Loved our servers and loved the atmosphere had a private party here and it was so beautiful. The food was AMAZING. Did not try any of the alcoholic beverages but loved the food
Good food and atmosphere
The bolognese and meatball tastes good. I would recommend them. Cocktail looks pretty, tastes ok.  I took outdoor dining and the setting is cute.

Last night I had a fantastic dinner with friends at Palma in Greenwich Village.

We ordered several dishes to share, accompanied by a crisp Vermentino.

To start: carciofi fritti, fiori di zucca, cecina (a Sardinian chickpea bread), and insalata di polpo, followed by their pesto-stuffed gnocchi and spaghetti alla Nerano.

For dessert, tiramisÃ¹ and an incredible chocolate Negroni (I know, it sounds weird but it was amazing).

The restaurant is beautiful, particularly the back dining room. Service, impeccable.
Gorgeous ambiance

My partner and I had been looking forward to Palma for months. The atmosphere and ambiance truly made for a perfect date night. However, the portion sizes did not meet our expectations given the pricing, and we couldnâ€™t help but comment on it throughout half the meal, ultimately leaving hungry and searching for another place to eat right after.

Visiting from New Jersey, weâ€™re familiar with NYC pricing, so that wasnâ€™t the issue. But when we ordered the $34 tortellini, we didnâ€™t expect just about 10 dime-sized pieces. The $39 chicken Milanese came as a single thin cutlet, it was gone in under five minutes, barely enough for one of us, let alone sharing.

To add to the disappointment, I found myself repeatedly seasoning the dishes with extra salt and pepper. For a $150+ meal, I didnâ€™t expect to be doing touch-ups at the table.

If youâ€™re looking for a charming, intimate setting, Palma certainly delivers on ambiance â€” just be prepared to make a second stop afterwards or cook at home to feel truly satisfied.

Lunch at Palma Was ABSOLUTELY outstanding! From the welcoming host greeting us when we came in to the flowers surrounding our table and ornate porcelain plates. Every detail makes you feel welcomed and cared for. The food is supremely fantastic with only the best locally sourced  ingredients. I highly recommend the Pissaladiere, which is from the French side of the menu a savory Provencal tart and the tiramisu! Buon appetito and Bon appÃ©tit!
Quite and cozy placeğŸ˜ğŸ™â€¦
I loved this place! The food, wine, and service were outstanding. Would highly recommend this place to others.
Very good and interesting Italian food. Appetizers and pastas were all very tasty. We were not rushed and were seated on time.
The people are really nice. The atmosphere is great...it was Friday, so you can tell how much people enjoyed it
Nice proportions. Good ambiance. Solid meal.

I'm still dreaming about my incredible dining experience at Palma! From the moment I walked in, I knew I was in for a treat. The atmosphere was cozy and intimate, with a warm and inviting decor that made me feel like I was in a little slice of Italy. But what really stole the show was the food - oh, the food! Every dish I tried was expertly prepared and presented, with flavors that danced on my palate. The service was also top-notch, with friendly and attentive staff who knew their stuff. If you're looking for an authentic Italian experience in the city, look no further than Palma. I'll be back, and soon! 5 stars isn't enough - I'd give it 10 stars if I could!

Cute
Placeâ˜ºï¸
Food was delicious

Oh my God, Palma is next level - I am totally obsessed with this place. It's located right on Cornelia Street in the West Village, which only adds to the charm of this spot!! The food is incredible + the cocktails are so delicious (their mezcal-based option is my favorite). Try their Arancini, Insulate dell 'Orto, and warm Focaccia to start. For primi, definitely sample their Ravioli Cacio e Pepe & Agnolotti agile Spinaci (everything is SO yummy). For dessert, spring for the gelato (the olive oil flavor is insanely good, as is their pistachio flavor). The cheesecake is light and isn't too sweet - it's wonderful. Also of note, the staff here are so kind & accommodating (shout-out to Hannah & Nick) and the vibes inside Palma are immaculate. You're surrounded by fresh flowers everywhere you go!! I cannot recommend this place enough!! Itâ€™s my favorite spot in the West Village.

ì´ ì‹ë‹¹ì— ì˜¤ë˜ë„ë¡ ë‰´ìš•ì— ìˆì—ˆìœ¼ë©´ ì¢‹ê² ì–´ìš”.

We came here to celebrate a friendâ€™s birthday, and honestly, this Italian restaurant didnâ€™t exactly exceed my expectations.

We ordered a lot of dishes, and I was especially looking forward to the Fried Artichokeâ€”itâ€™s what brought us here in the first place. But it ended up being just okayâ€¦ a bit over-fried and pretty average in flavor.

The duck pasta was also a letdownâ€”too salty, and the duck didnâ€™t taste very fresh. Then we had the lamb chops, which were under-seasoned, though the pumpkin puree underneath was surprisingly delicious.

The real stars of the meal were actually the seafood dishes. The fried calamari and the salad were so goodâ€”totally blew me away. If you come here, donâ€™t miss the seafood. Thatâ€™s where they shine.

One thing I really appreciated was the flowersâ€”every single one of them is real, no fakes. You can tell the owner really puts love into this place. The floral arrangements were absolutely beautiful, and I couldnâ€™t help but take a bunch of pictures.

My friends loved the decor tooâ€”itâ€™s such a photogenic spot, especially for girls. If your girlfriend or bestie has a birthday coming up, this place would definitely make her smile. The interior design is just stunning.

This place is the perfect pairing of rustic Italian food and a beautiful setting that makes you feel transported to Italy with sun-kissed stone, mosaics, and stucco. I have visited multiple times over the years, and every time I have had incredible pasta that feels homemade and cooked to perfection, fabulous wine (I've put in a picture of a Barolo we had that was simply heavenly), and have always been served by wonderful staff who are very invested in your enjoyment of the meal. I was told the restaurant was founded by an Italian grandmother and that "nonna" vibe certainly permeates each dish, to my delight.

I loved everything about Palma. The atmosphere, the food, the service, even the restrooms were all above and beyond.
The food is very rich in flavor and ingredients. Sauces and handmade pasta were all outstanding as well as the focaccia. We celebrated a birthday and the lemon sorbetto was on the house!
We sat outside in the garden area which is all enclosed. Absolutely beautiful experience.

Good food ..not exceptional. Although my first time but feels like I tasted this before in several places . Ambiance was excellently decorated and noise level was good to have conversations. They can improve the quality of chairs. Service was ok ..just ok. It did lack a smile.

Palma is one of those rare restaurants where the ambiance and food quality are perfectly in sync. Whether youâ€™re planning a romantic dinner or a special night out with friends, this place delivers an incredibly warm, intimate experience. The garden is especially charmingâ€”like a secret escape in the middle of the city. Highly recommend ordering a mix of the pastas, the focaccia, and the artichokes. And donâ€™t skip the Tiramisuâ€”itâ€™s the perfect ending to a beautiful meal.

If you have not yet experienced Palma, be sure to make a reservation today! Outstanding Italian food, vegetarian options available, extraordinary service, and a magnificent enclosed garden room make for a truly memorable meal.

Spent a long time looking for the perfect place to celebrate my daughterâ€™s bday. Palma was that place. Its authentic Italian cuisine was above par and exceeded my expectations. The atmosphere was just lovely and was just perfect for a 22 year oldâ€™s birthday with all the beautiful flowers and decor. Definitely worth a visit. Thank you Palma for making our families evening so special.

Hosted our engagement party here with close family. Everything was perfect - the food was delicious, the service was attentive and flawless, the ambiance was sublime. We were seated on the private terrace and felt like we were transported to a tuscan villa! Francesca and the event planning team were super - the constant communication, attention to detail, and care, was above and beyond. I look forward to hosting future events and regular dining at Palma in the future! This place is criminally underrated compared to its overrated Italian restaurants in the West Village area! Donâ€™t hesitate - dine here or host your event here. You wonâ€™t be disappointed.

My wife found this lovely restaurant on TIKTOK, and boy am I glad she did! If you get a chance try to be seated in the back of the restaurant. It will make you feel you are transported to a little restaurant in Italy.

The service was amazing, nicely paced and everything came out hot and delicious!

For appetizer we went with the Arancini they were so tasty! For the main course my wife got â€œtortellini in brodoâ€ and I got the special, which was lamb chops cooked to perfection and creamy mashed potatoes. And lastly for dessert we went with the  classic tiramisu. Drinks were nice and strong as well! This place definitely lives up to the hype! Will definitely will be recommending this restaurant to friends!

Truly excellent gluten-free pasta! Simply canâ€™t recommend this restaurant enough for their selection of gluten free and dairy free appetizers, entrÃ©es, and desserts (drinks were wonderful as well). Additionally, the atmosphere was quaint, quiet and cute; a lovely little getaway from the busy city. We were celebrating a birthday and the waiter made the extra effort to make the night extra memorable. Overall a great and delicious experience!

Visiting nyc and wanted to try a nice Italian spot. This place is so beautiful and cozy, great for a date night! Food was amazing and I believe their pasta is made fresh! Make sure you reserve in advance because seats get taken very quickly.

It was nice, the pasta was well made and had good portions. We also had nice cocktails.

Seating was tight but reasonable.

Went here for a date night, and thought it was awesome. We unfortunately didnâ€™t get seats in their garden, which should be noted as an indoor seat for those wondering, but sitting outside was still extremely pleasant. Even though the areaâ€¦

Amazing food, and excellent service. Went there for a late lunch and it was a great choice. It is also very close to Taylor Swiftâ€™s old apartment where the song Cornelia Street is taking place. If you are in the area, I definitely would recommend.

As an Italian, I have mixed feelings about this review because the staff was Italian and very nice - I found them incredibly professional and available. It was my friendâ€™s birthday and they accommodated her in everything and also offered us a limoncello.
But, at the same time, I found the good quite off in terms of taste and didnâ€™t enjoy my dinner at all.
The atmosphere is super nice, although the place a bit limited in size. Recommended for an intimate date.

Wow. What an incredible meal. The restaurant is beautiful, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, and the food is some of the best true Italian food weâ€™ve had outside of Italy. The fact that they also are super accommodating for gluten free is an added bonus - I canâ€™t believe I havenâ€™t been here sooner!

Do not skip the Tuna Crudo, Polpettine or Torta di Ricotta!

I have lived in NYC almost my entire life and I have struggled for really good Italian food. I know that is hard to believe in a city known for incredible Italian food. But I havenâ€™t found a restaurant that has incredible food with incredible atmosphere that take you of New York and feel like you are in Florence or Venice. Palma. Is it. The lobster spaghetti is out of this world. I will be going back to this spot a lot. 5/5.

Delightful lunch at Palma! The ambience was very cosy and being surrounded by beautiful flowers make us happy.  Food was great and the service was really good, which made our  ladies gathering so enjoyable. The tiramisu, tortellini in chicken broth and fritto misto were my favourites.  Portions were appropriate.  2 appetisers. 3 pastas and 3 desserts are enough for 4 asian femalesâ€™ stomachs. Menu also suitable for vegetarians.

Love this place! My partner and I came here for the first time and absolutely loved it. The service and food are incredible and the little backyard area is so sweet and romantic. My partner got gluten free pasta and I was SHOCKED at how amazing it was. The flavors were incredible. Such a wonderful experience and weâ€™ll definitely be back.
I was so delighted that Palma was able to accommodate both gluten free and dairy-free modifications.

The best Italian food weâ€™ve had since Italy. The arancini is some of the best weâ€™ve ever had. The pastas are homemade and fresh. The desserts are incredible. And of course the restaurant itself, will all the beautiful fresh flowers, and its garden are just breathtaking

Wanted to have a romantic dinner for my wifeâ€™s birthday. We decided on the place based off the area and the good reviews. The place is small but very beautiful. It feels like youâ€™re in a small town in Italy. At first they sat us at a small table and we asked if we could get a larger one since we felt a little squished. The manager was so kind and moved us immediately despite them being very busy. The manager of the restaurant is an absolute delight! She was very personable, kind and made our night so enjoyable. Our waitress was also very attentive and made sure we were enjoying everything. The food was delicious and fresh. We canâ€™t wait to come back next time we are in town. Ciao!

From the first bite to the last it was the best Italian food I've ever eaten in my life. Ive eaten at John besh restaurants, Emeril lagasse restaurants, and the best Italian food Louisiana has to offer.

You can taste everything in the dishes. The calamari tasted like the first thing fried in fresh oil in a brand new fryer.

The fried risotto I've had in Louisiana. It was unlike anything at palmas. Palmas were dusted with such a delicious Parm and parsley. The red sauce came through and made its own taste statement. We were moaning and wowing through our entire appetizer experience.

The Bolognese was flavorful, salted correctly, and the pasta was perfection.

Lastly had the tiramisu for desert and it was smooth cold light and subtle with all the dark flavors.

We felt at home under the courtyard lights. The staff was great, the atmosphere was beautiful. Palma has done such a wonderful job with the roses and we couldn't have been happier to dine here for our last night in NYC. The only sad part of the night was our last bite. Thank you from Phillip in Louisiana. â¤ï¸

Did lots of research on Italian restaurants before visiting New York and Iâ€™m so glad we booked a table at Palma. Itâ€™s some of the best Italian food Iâ€™ve ever had. The food, wine, and service was all fantastic. We sat â€œoutsideâ€ in the courtyard and it was lovely. It did get quite loud in there - a warning for those hard of hearing. But we loved that as part of the atmosphere. If I ever make it back, I would 100% be booking this restaurant.
